    • initialization

      @BeforeEach public void initialization()

    • ConquerTest

      @ParameterizedTest @CsvSource({"5, 6, 11","0, 11, 11","5, 7, 12"}) public void ConquerTest(int indexFirstIsland, int indexSecondIsland, int expectedNumOfIslands)
      test check if after conquerIsland() is called, the number of islands is decreased if the conquered islands are adjacent. tests all cases, the normal conquest, the conquest of two islands at the ends of the array and the conquest of two not adjacent islands Number of Islands is expected to be 11 after method gets called on two adjacent islands, 12 otherwise.
      Parameters:
      indexFirstIsland - index of the first conquered island
      indexSecondIsland - index of the second conquered island
      expectedNumOfIslands - number of islands remaining after the same player has conquered two islands

    • tripleMergingTest

      @ParameterizedTest @CsvSource({"11, 1, 0, 10","1, 2, 5, 11"}) public void tripleMergingTest(int indexFirstIsland, int indexSecondIsland, int indexThirdIsland, int expectedNumberOfIsland)
      Checking if merge works if the same player conquer three islands In the first case all three conquered islands are close to each other. these are expected to unite and the final number of islands to become 10. In the second case, only 2 of the 3 conquered islands are close. Only the two neighboring islands are expected to merge and the number of islands will become 11.
      Parameters:
      indexFirstIsland - index of the first conquered island
      indexSecondIsland - index of the second conquered island
      indexThirdIsland - index of the third conquered island
      expectedNumberOfIsland - number of islands remaining after the same player has conquered three islands

    • alreadyConqueredTest

      @Test public void alreadyConqueredTest()
      Checking if merge works when island is already conquered by another player
